page.title: 10LANGUAGE
page.content: In 1985 it is becoming difficult to find people who use the genuine Devon dialect. The influences of education, radio, television and travel_as well as the integation into the community of people from other parts of the country-have all contirtbuted to the general "Leveling_out" of standard English. Nevertheless, there are still a marked and recognisable accent and a local intauation.This varies from one area to another, and differs in the rural from the more settled parts, often within quite a short distance.
